subject: p14312560
History: Esophageal varices and recent hematocrit drop.
Findings: There are increased pulmonary vascular markings and redistribution. Prominent azygos vein is also noted. There is mild cardiomegaly, unchanged. No focal consolidation, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax is seen. The NG tube courses through the esophagus and terminates outside the field of view.
